snippet: The decision to form the force was meant to send a message to Russia that NATO’s principle of collective security is sacrosanct.
abstract: NATO announces limited steps to deter Russia in Eastern Europe and starts to marshal broader international support to confront Islamic State in Iraq and Syria in the Middle East; alliance has struggled to find responses to new challenges as it concludes its summit meeting in Wales.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER, JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and STEPHEN CASTLE

lead_paragraph: The decision to form the force was meant to send a message to Russia that NATO’s principle of collective security is sacrosanct.

headline.main: NATO Plans a Special Force to Reassure Eastern Europe and Deter Russia
headline.print_headline: NATO Plans a Special Force to Reassure Eastern Europe and Deter Russia

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
